title: PLS NERF DEVOURER
body:
Clearly everyone knows that devourer is extremely strong, especially on certain junglers. Actually, 90% of bans are of junglers who can dominate and snowball well with devourer, such as Shyvana, Kayle, Xin Zhao, etc. Is it just me or is it pretty obvious there's a problem here?

If a champion with devourer can just stand there, tank damage because they are naturally tanky, and easily get a triple kill because the item makes them very strong... Is that skill or just OP?

replies.body:
Devourer champions can be managed if you know how to shut them down early, i.e. counter jungeling, invading and keeping track of the enemy jungler.
Although a nerf to the early game might be appropriate, so maybe add AS growth per stack instead of giving a flat amount. There was a post about this already but I'm too lazs to find the link :P sorry

They are hard (shyvana is near impossible) to 1v1 early game, so counterjungling is out of the window.

you can still counter jungle just know where the enemy jungler is and you dont always have to take high priority buffs that almost kill you earlier you can kill the large krug or large razor  the then get the buffs mid game

xin because he can combine devourer with decent early pressure

Xin I've got no answer for since I've always struggled with him, but Shyvana is simply a matter of kiting her. If you have a slow, stun, CC of any kind, you wait for her to pop W and then hit her with it. The move speed buff decays over time, so even getting slowed for just a second right at the start of it greatly reduces its effectiveness, and to increase the duration of it she needs to be hitting something, so if she can't get in range then it just falls off even faster. She gets one free jump on you, but she has to ult to do it, and then she has no built-in slows or CC so if you can put any distance between you and her she goes back to being kitable again. Also, if you have a really pro tank or something on your team, if she gets CCd mid-ult then she just gets completely fucked, because she's not unstoppable during the leap like Malph or Vi are.

then dont go when they are there if they are half way across the map by gromp razor and krugs are free for you and if you and allies keep your side lanes to the jungle warded he most likely cant get in with out you seeing when he realises waht youa re doing it will delay his  sated power spike by 10-20 mins depending on how often you do it

To me, I ban them because I don't trust my team to deal with them. Personally as a jungler, I dislike the item and don't use it. I also rarely have problems with them. With people playing champs like Yi, Xin, Shyv, ect, it lets you open to play high pressure, absurdly tanky junglers like Rammus, Zac, and Hec, all of which fit very well against the devour champs. You can output much more pressure early, and come late game, you can either sit on top of them as someone like Zac or Hec, or taunt them and cause them to kill themselves with someone like Rammus. 

Is it strong? Maybe a bit too strong, but I think part of the problem is people just don't know how to play against them. Keep scuttle control, keep drag warded, counter jungle whenever possible, ward his jungle deep to collapse on him (normally their squishy so two people can kill him no problem, ect.)

here is the problem with devourer

- 100% auto attack dependent. whats the going to accomplish in team fights? not shit. 

- no early game ganks to speak of since the jungler will be farming heavily in jungle.

- if counter jungled u may as well ff20.

- its really boring farming for 15-20 minutes

- can be countered easily

Here is the problem with your argument.

*This is the dumbest argument ever. So the enemy sated xin jumping on the adc and knocking all of their teammates away will murdering her instantly isnt effective. Have you even seen a sated shyv in a team fight mate? ADC's are 100 percent auto attack dependent but good thing they dont do shit in team fights right? 

*This is wrong too. Plenty of junglers that go sated have great early ganks and if you are above silver know that ganking gives you stacks as well for assists and kills. Those would be junglers like jax, xin, and udyr all have great early games with great early ganks. You can't counter jungle any of them because they can easily kill you. especially jax and xin. This is also assuming that you picked your jungler after they picked theirs because if you picked a cinderhulk jungler you are fucked. Amumu, malphite, etc cannot counter jungler so unless you picked lee or elise (who is banned every game) then you cant counter jungle as they can easily kill you.

*see previous point

*Yeah because boredom plays a part in why an item is balanced lol. Farming for 30 minutes with nasus is boring, but shitting on everybody late game is plenty worth it. Same with devourer.

*lol no

Considering the high winrate that devourer champs currently have, I think a small nerf is appropriate. It's not that much stronger than Runeglaive and Cinderhulk but compared to Warrior... The gap is a bit too big. I think buffing Warrior or reworking it so that warrior champions have a chance again (seriously, the only warrior jungler above 50% winrate is shaco!!!) will be a nerf to devourer junglers because stronger early game opponent junglers will make their chance at getting lategame earlier a lot lower.

I had a miserable game yesterday against a Devourer Shaco. It's DISGUSTINGLY scary. Warrior is good for 1v1, but have you ever faced a Shaco who clears EVERYTHING fast throughout the game? As a late game Devourer Aatrox, he was still clearing almost as fast (But he had counter jungled so well that he was crazy fed before I got Sated). Oh that game....Lux was a horrible team player, great player, but horrible communicator...I digress :(
On the bright side, while Shaco still hasn't acheived Sated, his ult feels semi-useless as the dog only displays and follows the real Shaco :P

I think the problem with nerfing (again) the AS jungle item is that the champions that really needed the boost re going back to darkness, while those that are abusing Devourer will simply jump ship and go abuse the latest item Riot puts out. I believe its time to adress _those_ champions instead of nerfing the item, at least as a first step.

Of course, the inverse is also true, and the champions that need Devourer like Aatrox and Noc may need buufs themselves, instead of depending on a crutch like Devourer.

Then again Shyvana is easily the biggest FotM item abuser (remember Cindertop Shyvana!). Maybe its time to admit some champions like shyvana are lowkey broken and are in a constant ''seeking of items to abuse'' state.

See that's the problem though is you shouldn't be nerfing champs because of an item. What about people that play those champs in other roles beside jungle? The item is the main problem because it's adding to much power to any champ with an on hit ability.

Which is why I mentioned that the inverse is also true. The item may be a crutch for thosethat need it but maybe instead of the easily abusable crutch Riot needs to adress the champions on the weak end like Aatrox and Noc.

It's not even Devourer that's the problem.  It's the crazy strong on hit ability *anyone* can buy and combo with it.  {{item:3153}} 
Oh yeah, and it also adds AS to even further improve your on hit abilities, DPS, sustain, burst, and makes you better at kiting *and* harder for others to kite you.
I thought Devourer was never used in high rank, competitive, due to the fact that it's a farming item when the jungle xp/gold is fed to specific carry members of the team (read: not the jungler)
5 out of 6 bans are not for Devourer champs in my elo... guess it's another "the higher the skill the worse the item"?

Yes, it is. Without it I'd only proc my ult every 3 attack rather than 2, and I would only do 8% current health on hit rather than 8% on the first hit and 16% on the second. Without it I'd barely do any damage, so yes, it is the most broken part of the build.
And rework Warrior.

Did you see the PBE changes to Warrior? Swapped out the armor pen for the ability to do 10% (or something, dont remember exactly) of the attack's damage in true dmg over time? That seemed like a cool idea, and made for an item that scales a lot better than the average warrior, which I often end up selling if the game ends up lasting really long, whereas all of the other jungle item enchants feel quite powerful, even into the later stages of the game.

Kayle is probably one of the easiest jungles to abuse.  Kayle has no early game ganking pressure.  Her gank paths are predictable.  Her jungle path is pretty predictable.  She has no escape.  She needs a lot of time to scale.  She doesn't dive very well until 6 and even then, she only brings a slow.  She can't fight off enemy junglers on her own.  Her clear speed isn't amazing, though her sustain is decent if she has blue.  But yeah, she does do a lot of damage 30-40 minutes into the game.
